_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

A.     Introduction

S&M Farms is a farm that uses Anhydrous Ammonia to grow crops. This facility is a closed group and does not retail anhydrous ammonia.  This facility has an excellent safety record with no deaths or serious injuries to owners or contractors due to the RMP covered process. There have been no accidents in the past 5 years.



B.     Accidental Release Prevention Policies and Program

S&M Farms strives to meet or exceed compliance with state anhydrous ammonia regulations. Training is provided every three years as required by OSHA. The anhydrous ammonia tank(s) and associated equipment are inspected following recommended industry and engineering frequencies.Pressurized tank(s) and plumbing are tested according to the standards for the pressure vessel testing.



C.    Emergency Response Policies and Programs



Each partner and workers filling tanks are trained to be familiar with the emergency response policies and procedures through safety reviews. This facility has an Emergency Plan which covers accidental releases, natural disasters, security incidents and other emergency response practices and procedures. The Emergency Plan for this facility is reviewed and updated on a regular basis as part of a comprehensive review process. The Emergency Plan for this facility includes specific instructions for the partners regarding the response procedures to an emergency. The procedures provided in the Emergency Plan are shared with all partners and their workers and followed in the event of an emergency. The local emergency planning committee and fire department personnel are furnished a copy of the Emergency Plan for this facility and invited for a tour on a regular basis.



D.    Worse-Case Scenario/Alternative-Case Scenario



This facility has developed a worse-case and an alternative-case scenario however it has been withheld from this Executive Summary as security-sensitive information as requested by EPA.



E.    Five Year Accident History

This facility has an excellent safety record with no deaths or serious injuries to any of its partners or workers as a result of the RMP covered process. In addition, there have been no accidents resulting in releases of anhydrous ammonia with off-site consequences during the entire operation period. Extensive programs and procedures are in place to maintain this record.



F.    Planned Changes to Improve Safety



The owners and partners are continuously looking for ways to enhance the safety of this location. Regular safety inspections are conducted which result in corrective actions: equipment inspections are also conducted, and detailed environmental health and safety audits are conducted at least every three years.



G.    Summary



The partners of this facility are extremely proud of the safety record and improvements made in both environmental stewardship and safety. We believe with our programs and policies in place and with the continued efforts of our personnel, we will maintain our safety record and our safe facility environment for the public and partners.
